title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Monday 6 July 2015 - BBC News
summary: man shot in the back in rushden not said to have life-threatening injuries .
police officers and teachers from northamptonshire have been at westminster abbey for the uk srebrenica memorial day .
police acting in an advisory capacity after 12 travellers caravans turned up at northampton 's sixfields stadium .

text: earlier the northampton chronicle & echo
we 've been told that the countywide traveller unit 's police liaison officer has visited the site at sixfields where they say there are 12 caravans .
they say that as this is private land the countywide traveller unit is working in an advisory capacity .

documents.title: more on weedon planning 'inconsistencies '
text: campaigners in weedon say planning inspectors are making what they say are `` inconsistent '' decisions .
recently one plan for 121 houses was given the go-ahead , while another for 26 was turned down .
daventry mp chris heaton-harris met with
planning inspectors have to be independent , so the government ca n't tell them what decision to come to , but there could be guidance on how planning policies should be interpreted .
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

text: injuries suffered by a man who was shot in the back are not said to be life threatening , police say .
officers are
two men were approached by two offenders who threatened them with a gun .
one of the men was shot in the back and taken to university hospital coventry .
officers believe that this was an isolated incident .

documents.title: srebrenica memorial day
text: i 've been at westminster abbey today for the uk srebrenica memorial day .
it 's the biggest memorial outside of bosnia and there were more than 2,000 people here earlier .
police officers , faith leaders and teachers , who have seen the scars of srebrenica first hand as part of educational visits to the region , attended from northamptonshire .
tonight on bbc one there is
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: greyfriars : developers to produce 'concept plan '
text: earlier
i 've got some more on that story now from councillor tim hadland , the council 's member for regeneration .
he said work to remove thousands of tonnes of rubble from the site is continuing , with the council hopeful the land will be returned to them `` later in the summer '' .
mr hadland said : `` we intend to ask developers to submit expressions of interest and their ideas for the site - which we have called a concept plan - which will then be shortlisted .
we expect to have appointed a developer by the beginning of 2016 . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kettering art winner announced
text: artist martin sellars has been announced as the kettering
his piece 'seven for a secret ' is an oil painting of seven magpies and came top of the poll which had over 1,000 votes .
kettering museum and art gallery have offered mr sellars a solo exhibition at the alfred east art gallery in autumn 2016 .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: council to demolish 'eyesore '
text: wellingborough council has purchased a dilapidated
the property , based at 31-32 church street , which the council describe as an 'eyesore , ' has been in need of repair for a decade .
as the building was privately owned , the council was unable to do anything other than make sure it was safe .
now the authority owns the building , it can be demolished .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'inconsistent ' planning decisions in weedon
text: people in weedon are demanding government action to stop planning inspectors making what they say are `` inconsistent '' decisions .
plans for 120 houses in new street were given the go-ahead last month by one inspector , while another turned down proposals for 26 houses near croft road .

documents.title: british grand prix : crime halved
text: crime over the british grand prix weekend at silverstone dropped by 50 % compared to the previous year ,
by the end of the race on sunday , a total of 17 crimes had been recorded during the weekend compared to 33 at the same point in 2014 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burglary increase in summer
text: northamptonshire police say 20 % of burglaries happen in the early summer months .
in all 2,308 burglaries were reported in the county from april 2014 to april this year , of which 532 occurred between 1 april and the end of june last year .
i spoke to a lady in northampton who was burgled two years ago .
author: Stuart Linnell
Presenter, BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: last ball win for northants
text: northamptonshire steelbacks are
the steelbacks set the hosts 155 to win , a score later reduced to 144 from 18 overs because of torrential rain .
superb bowling at the death by mohammad azharullah meant the steelbacks went home with the points .
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton Sport

documents.title: srebrenica memorial day
text: i 'm at the uk srebrenica memorial day at westminster abbey today .
it 's the biggest memorial event outside of bosnia , marking the 20th year since the mass killing of 8,000 muslim men and boys in 1995 .
i 'll keep you updated across the day with events here - and there 'll be more to come throughout the week .
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: british grand prix : 'a race desperately needed '
text: all season the talk has been of formula 1 being faced with some sort of existential crisis , but the sport put on its best face for a thrill-a-minute british grand prix in front of the biggest silverstone crowd for more than 20 years .

lewis hamilton 's superb victory , the climax of an afternoon of action and drama enlivened by a late downpour , showcased all that is good about f1 , and 140,000 fans were treated to what was undoubtedly the
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer
